I wonder if this would work better in erlfdb and a few API calls to hide the pdict keys inside.

If a transaction fails, during reading say with a 1007 (transaction too old) or on commit during writes, we have to make sure we reset or clear the cached GRV. In the 1007 or 1020 (commit conflict) case I think re-using a grv will just generate the same error again.

It would be somewhere around here https://github.com/apache/couchdb-erlfdb/blob/main/src/erlfdb.erl#L680

I don't believe so, if the txn hits a 1007 the request has failed, it took too long.

Where we do need to refetch the grv is if we perform any write in a different txn that we are waiting on in the original process. The most obvious case is when querying a stale view. With this PR, that never works, because all txn's started on the http process will use the same grv, the one used to fetch security properties and check if the view is built. When the async process that updates that view (couch_view_jobs) completes, the http process can't query it because it won't fetch a new grv. Fun!

1007 is not always thrown due to the transaction taking too long, sometimes it's because the transaction system is recovering (getting new master, tlogs, etc).
 
https://github.com/apple/foundationdb/blob/8d9e7adac7b8b46919e5c75e4d8b17457b8c41f6/documentation/sphinx/source/architecture.rst

> Finally, a recovery will fast forward time by 90 seconds, which would abort any in-progress client transactions with transaction_too_old error. During retry, these client transactions will find the new generation of transaction system and commit.

It's also a retry-able error. That means the expectation is that the transaction will be retried, and in that case we most likely would want to get a new grv. 

And good point on grvs being stale when we wait on other processes. We'd need to hand tweak resetting the grv or have a centralized (per/node) where we say something like "this is the highest seen grv on this node, if your version in the request process is older, may want to use this newer grv instead".
